Description: Sycomore fig wood shabti completely painted black with a lappet wig, facial features that are marked in yellow as are the collar and the two hoes held in the crossed relief hands, the front of the legs is inscribed with a central column of yellow painted hieroglyphs flanked by two yellow lines, the back is decorated with a representation of a yellow seed-basket and a yoke with two pendular nu-pots.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
